roleset.name: chastise, rebuke
roleset.note: CHIDE-V NOTES: Could also be a verb of saying. And shouldn't the past be "chidd"?Or, god forbid, "chad"? (from chide.01-v)

example.name: active
example.text: We recall that Mr. Roberts not only chides the Chancellor for being too easy because of a desire to constrain sterling, but also led the chorus saying that Mr. Volcker was too tight when he let the dollar rise.
example.arg: for being too easy because of a desire to constrain sterling

example.name: passive
example.text: Mr. Bush has asked Congress to provide more than $400 million in economic aid and food grants for Poland's new government, but has been chided *trace* by Democrats for failing to do more.
